snippet: Since protests inspired by the Arab Spring rocked Jordan 15 months ago, King Abdullah II, who promised electoral changes, has replaced three prime ministers.
abstract: King Abdullah II of Jordan swears in new cabinet assigned to make progress on laws allowing for more government posts to be filled by elections, but political activists and analysts say that the quick succession of three governments over the past year and a half does not bode well for the prospect of genuine reform.

byline.original: By RANYA KADRI and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Ranya Kadri reported from Amman, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Since protests inspired by the Arab Spring rocked Jordan 15 months ago, King Abdullah II, who promised electoral changes, has replaced three prime ministers.

headline.seo: Latest Shift in Jordan’s Cabinet Sows Doubts on Reform
headline.main: New Doubts Over Reform as Jordan Shifts Cabinet
headline.print_headline: New Doubts Over Reform As Jordan Shifts Cabinet

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
